column3: ~~ACK https://github.com/pinheadmz/bitcoin/commit/7f01e4e6411418bee3888caadf9fdb59b4b99622~~\nRight, using "index" instead of "position" is better here.\n

Before merging, can you please squash these changes into one commit? e.g.

``` bash
$ git rebase -i 8b70a64
```

In the editor, replace the second 'pick' with 'f', then save and exit.
Then, force-push the result to this branch with

``` bash
git push -f origin master
```

@laanwj I guess this could be backported to 0.12.1

Also, Post-merge ACK.
Backported as part of #7938. Removing label 'Needs backport'.\n

tiny nit: `position` seems slightly non-conventional?

> The **index** of the transaction in the block that includes it.
I'd prefer to stick with index too. It has a well-defined meaning, while position is too general (it could be a byte offset, or a set of 3D coordinates within the unit block...).\n
